Reviews.Title: Worst phone I ever had....EVER
Reviews.Author: Theprophet6661
Reviews.Content: Aside from the fact that I paid $400 for this phone, it sucked so bad. I cant say it any other way. It literally dies every 4 hours and whats the point of having a phone if you cant even use it? You might as well implant a usb port into your arm because you will be taking the recharge chord EVERY WHERE. I gave it a 2 instead of a 1 because I loved the double keyboard and screen is big. But thats where it ends. This phone is just plain useless, I would make 4 (5min) calls when I had this phone with perhaps 7 min of surfing and it still would die on me in less than 6 hours. I regret spending so much money on this piece of garbage phone. Not to mention the 4G on Metropcs is non existent 94% of the time.I was with metro for 6 years and Im glad I moved to boost mobile. Not only was there internet faster and more reliable, I stuck with the tried and true blackberry and cant be any happier. Its a curve so it doesnt have touch screen, but if I had to sacrifice communication for 3 hrs of touch screen then CLEARLY its not worth it. Do not buy, you will be happy you didnt.

Reviews.Title: Huge disappointment in phone and in MetroPCS
Reviews.Author: Penguin
Reviews.Content: This is my second Android phone, my first one being an LG Optimus V with Virgin Mobile. I have had this phone for two months. Now, it's likely I have a faulty phone when it comes to my data connection issues, but there are numerous other problems as well and I have very little good to say about this phone.First, my data problems. I live in a maximum coverage location yet I only ever have 2 out of 4 bars on my call signal, and my data signal jumps around between 1x, 3g and 4g every 20 seconds or so, often with long breaks of no signal inbetween. I often have to restart my phone and/or pull the battery out to get my signal back. Toggling airplane mode sometimes helps. Even when I have 4g signal displayed, pages load slowww even on my Opera Mini browser. I have made numerous calls to MetroPCS and have had several things attempted, including a magical and mysterious "trouble ticket" issued, which was "resolved" without helping the problem and I am unable to get details on what, if anything was done. finally they are telling me to go to a Metro corporate store, and the only one in my area doesn't have an accessible phone number and is not even listed as a metropcs store at the address on google maps. Shady.other than that, the battery life is horrendous. i am charging my phone 2-3 times a day because it dies every couple of hours with light to moderate use and it seems it takes longer for the battery to charge than it does for it to drain.the keyboard keys are flush, so typing isn't very comfortable or easy because you can't really feel the buttons.as of this review, metropcs charges a minimum of $50/month plan for android phones although they advertise for $40/month, which apparently does not apply to their smartphones.the only good thing about this phone is the call quality, which is probably the best ive heard in the couple of phones ive owned. the camera is okay as well, a 3.2 megapixel which seems to be standard on smartphones.to sum it all up, i am leaving the ugly memory of metropcs behind, and getting an LG Optimus Slider on virgin mobile, whose 3g in my experience is faster and more reliable than metro's 4g and it also doesnt drain battery as quickly.

Reviews.Title: Might as well not be called a smart phone
Reviews.Author: Rebecca McKinnon
Reviews.Content: I paid about $250 for this "smart" phone, but it was rarely ever smart during the 6 months I used it. I agree with all of the other users about the battery life, but that's an issue with most smartphones that I can overlook with a battery app or extended battery. The main issues I had with this phone are issues you cannot solve without just buying another phone.1. GPS. Or should I say...no GPS. Ever. The times I did get GPS, my location was incorrect by at least 500 feet. I never could get turn by turn navigation. I always had to just type the from and to addresses into Maps because it would never be worth the wait for it to find my location...my location being "temporarily unavailable" pretty much always.2. Signal. I also live in a big city with supposedly great coverage (according to Metro's coverage map). It would say I had full bars and then act like I had none...going on the Internet, the Market, even using simple Internet-based apps like Daily Horoscope... I could only manage to access these things about 30% of the time. Because of the horrible signal.3. Signal cont... I have a friend that lives in one of the "text/data-only" zones on Metro's coverage map. This was a main reason I switched to Metro from T-Mobile. I thought I would have at least one bar and/or texting ability when I went to visit her. Incorrect. Absolutely no data in a supposedly data-supported area. I'm switching carriers again (a Verizon phone through Straight Talk) because Metro is just not worth it.4. The touchscreen. It worked fine for about the first month or two. Then it started acting weird, not responding to my touch. Not showing the call screen as a call was coming in and forcing me to miss multiple calls as I swiped and swiped the screen with no response from it. Every other time I use it, I have to touch the same spot on the screen about 3 times before it recognizes that I'm telling it do something.I thought I could fix these things by factory resetting it. No good. I thought about calling in the warranty but after reading online about a lot of similar issues other customers have had...I seriously think this is just a poorly designed smart phone and that's why cheap MetroPCS could afford to sell it. Switch carriers. And don't buy this phone.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the price
Reviews.Author: JohnFTL
Reviews.Content: This phone isn't worth even one-third of what it costs. It looks nice but functionality is poor. The complaints about the horrible battery life are true, although this is a problem with android phones in general its much worse with this phone than it is with others I have used. The phone can also be slow to respond at times, Sometimes you'll be touching the buttons on the touch screen repeatedly and nothing happens. At other times it will just freeze up completely and you have to reboot it to get it to start working again. This happens far too often, and since other people have experienced it then it must be a design flaw. The thing I dislike most about it though is the horrible service reception. Some of this I'm sure has to do with MetroPCS...lots of dropped calls, and lots of connectivity issues when you're trying to use the GPS and internet...very annoying. I would not recommend this phone.

I cannot recommend ORLANDO GADGETS to anyone - they are unreachable and I believe that the phone advertised as NEW was really an improperly REFURBISHED phone.

Reviews.Title: Not worth 299.99
Reviews.Author: Erick "-Erick"
Reviews.Content: I got this phone as a replacement from MetroPCS. I had the LG Esteem but it was out of stock and they offered me this one so I said sure. That was around late September/early October. The back of this phone is super sensitive, I dropped it on carpet a couple times when I got it and it got a huge dent. The Camera's OK, No zoom option. A lot of the time I press the home button from whatever app I'm using and it lags then when it gets there it doesn't show the apps right away and you press the Applications icon and none of the apps are being shown just the loading icon. Often if it dies or you just turn it off and you try to turn it back on it will stay on the Samsung Logo for a really long time. I've had to take the battery out and retry 5-8 times until it eventually Reboots. Also it will often show the 4G icon, showing that it had 4G Data and when you try to use the internet it will just tell you you have no data connection. When I try to make a call, it'll often just not do anything. You press the Call button once or twice and it won't do anything, 2-3 minutes later it will make the call. To conclude my rambling, just don't buy the phone.

Reviews.Content: I bought this phone when it first came out on sale for 250.00  with all discounts and acces.  The battery life is the worst, it worked when it wanted. It tries to reset itself for no less than 15 min.  I would not recommend this phone

Reviews.Title: great experience with this phone
Reviews.Author: c
Reviews.Content: just wanted to say that i go truh cellphones like crazy, probably 5 a year, its always something, i don't like this or that,that doesn't work right, this stays on, that doesn't turn off etc,yeah im pretty fuzzy, ive had my indulge for a year and i absolutely love it!! i think the biggest gripe that people have is the battery life and i know what im about to say wont help anyone but i use my phone very little,i use to have a real busy social life and one day i just decided i was tired of the hassle so now i might make 2 0r 3 calls a day and that's it.  i use my internet on the phone for about a half hour each day and probably send about 20 texts and ive never had the battery drain completely,all these cellphones these days are not very battery friendly and thats a universal problem so no sense getting irate over that,i think we are lucky to have cellphones as it is, think about it, a little box that enables you to talk to your buddy 5 thousand miles away,that's freaking amazing in itself!! on the battery issue i don't think its the phone's fault but the batteries they are designing right now,smartphones are a relatively new invention and i think in a few years maybe they will have a battery that will last 5 days without recharging,all i can say is that i hope i can keep my phone forever cause its the best one ive had in a long time,i dont live in the jungle so there's always a port or a cigarrete lighter handy if i need to top the battery off, the only complain i have is that i have to reset it probably 2 times a week (pull the battery) it locks up for no reason, sometimes its only once a week so no biggie,im sure it has to do with these things having so many stuff in them i guess it gets a little confused sometimes,lol.  everything is easy to use,one of the reason i picked this model specifically was because of the keyboard, im one of those that likes to have actual buttons to push,not a big fan of the touch screen texting. when i first got the phone i dropped it at work and to my surprise the screen shattered pretty bad,(i thought the screens on these phones were plastic) i was still able to use it with no problems, i ordered a new screen from amazon (20 bucks) and installed it myself, not really hard to do but you have to pay attention to what your doing,im sure this phone is  not for everyone and it wont suit some peoples needs but it has mine and i really like it and thats all that matters to me.

Reviews.Title: Good phone but held back by strong flaws...
Reviews.Author: Bryan T
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as it went on sale for the price of $299. At the time I was with Verizon paying way too much monthly for my bill. I had a monthly bill of $80 without any internet and whatnot. I ended up buying this "sweet deal" because I thought 4g for $60 flat rate a month. So I bought this phone mainly because I was in awe of the touchscreen, keyboard, and many applications that Android offers on this phone. This phone has a couple of drawbacks when you get past the glitz and glamour of a 4g phone.The main drawback to this phone is the battery life. This is my main complaint and has frustrated me beyond belief. When you buy this phone just make sure you have 3 different chargers, one for your house, one for your car, and one for your workplace because this phone will NOT last a normal 8 hour workday. I cannot believe how short this battery life is. I tried now downloading a app that was supposed to help save energy. This program was supposed to adjust the screen brightness, the 4g, and the all the other options that take battery juice. This program does not work; I still have to plug my phone in every 5 hours depending on usage. This is the main drawback of the phone, soif you're buying this just know this is what you will get.The other drawback is what you pay for the phone with Metro PCS. You will think you're getting the best phone from Metro but in fact after paying the big chunk of change for the phone, you will want this to be protected. After having this phone for a year I was paying $5 a month for insurance, and now I am wondering what I paid for. I finally cracked my screen after dropping it a hundred times and was bitter to find out what I was paying for. For this model the deductible for this phone is $129 just to get a new one. This is on top of the $5 a month to get that deductible deal which I think is a joke. I know this is how Metro works so just know that if you break the phone, you will plan on spending half of what you paid to get it.Overall this phone has treated me well with internet and 4g usage, but beyond the fact the battery will not last you more the 5 hours this phone is frustrating. It's hard to be happy about a phone with great features when you cannot use it because the battery is always dead.

Reviews.Title: Not worth that much at all
Reviews.Author: JGOV "chipsandtechs"
Reviews.Content: Hello,Reviews for devices like this should be done after generous usage, not first day!  I purchased this phone a few months back and its a B- at best.The battery is extremely bad, don't believe that it was overlooked. This more than likely was agreed on by the carriers (Metro/Cricket) and Samsung.  In other words, the faster your battery drains, the more skeptic you'll be about using your "unlimited data"The only way to fix this issue was to root it. Which I don't recommend unless you know how to very well, it can brick the phone.  It happened to me but I fixed it.The audio system begins to fail after a while, skipping, distortion etc.  One way to correct it is be reboot it. If it doesn't fix the issue the do a factory reset which ultimately helps.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy used!
Reviews.Author: SilverXion
Reviews.Content: When the phone arrived I switched my number over at a Metro PCS location and they told me I needed the original SIM card to get 4G speeds, which didn't come included. I thought, "Ok, no 4G. It's still a great phone and I dig the keyboard. Switch my number over."They switched it over and I had no service! Apparently the Samsung Galaxy Indulge was "bricked" and I needed the original SIM card or I could pay for new one after a corporate location "unrooted" the phone and assigned it a fresh one. Really...? It was my mistake to assume that Metro PCS phones don't require SIM cards. This one did and it didn't come included in the box.I'm giving it 2 stars because the seller refunded my money so quickly! I printed the return packaging labels and tried to tie and wrap everything like it was originally. I taped the barcode labels to the box, sent it back and the rest is history.

Reviews.Title: Before you complain about battery life
Reviews.Author: Sayasugizo
Reviews.Content: Battery life seems to be a big issues with users who have this phone. You aren't the only one. I have been bothered with the life also but I found a way around that.EXTENDED BATTERY!With the extended battery the phone lasts longer. How long? I say a day or 2. However, the extended battery comes with a back door cover because the battery is thick for it's width. Here: http://www.amazon.com/Extended-Battery-Replace-Replacement-Faceplate/dp/B0058N5LBC/ref=pd_cp_cps_0If you don't mind having a fat, thick phone then I recommend buying this.P.S. Go to the market (Google Play) and search for battery life. They have several apps that can help you with battery life too.

Reviews.Title: Slow, weak battery, poor design
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone through MetroPCS as my on-the-road cell phone. What a mistake. Aside from the fact that MetroPCS coverage is very, very limited (meaning, it basically doesn't work outside of Florida), the phone itself has too many problems with it. The first, and most obvious, is the battery life. On a full charge, I would get maybe a couple hours of usage from it. And if in the rare instance where I would get 4G (and by rare I mean, out of some three months of owning this phone, I found 4G in only a couple cities on the eastern coast of Florida), the battery would run maybe 20 minutes. Next, is the processing. This phone is SLOW. For one, it takes 3-4 minutes just to boot up. And then the operations are slow as well. And the design leaves much to be desired. All in all, this is a major fail.
